byline.contributor: Julia Angwin and Jeff Larson report for ProPublica. Laura Poitras contributed reporting.
byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE, JULIA ANGWIN, JEFF LARSON and HENRIK MOLTKE

abstract: Classifed National Security Agency documents provided by Edward J Snowden indicate Obama administration, sans public notice, has expanded agency's warrantless surveillance of Americans' international internet traffic to hunt for evidence of malicious computer hacking; disclosures come at time of pernicious cyberattacks, but also of increased scrutiny of legal rights for more government surveillance.
lead_paragraph: Searching for evidence of computer hacking originating abroad, the Obama administration has stepped up warrantless monitoring, documents show.

headline.main: Hunting for Hackers, N.S.A. Secretly Expands Internet Spying at U.S. Border
headline.print_headline: In a Secret Step, N.S.A. Expanded Internet Spying

snippet: Searching for evidence of computer hacking originating abroad, the Obama administration has stepped up warrantless monitoring, documents show.

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
